page.title: 10KNOB FARM RIPLEY DERBYSHIRE.
page.content: Knob Farm near Ripley is small.The farmer is Mr Allen.He has 83 acres which is mainly sown grass with a little rough grazing.He does not find it hard to farm near Ripley but the land isn't very good for growing crops because a lot of his land has been opencast mined and then 10 years ago the A38 was built through his farm,and he has to use a footbridge to get over the A38 to his fields on the other side.He owns the farm which is about 150 years old.He owns a baler,3 tractors,a muck spreader,a fertilizer sprayer and a hay turner.He keeps cows sheep and chickens and sells eggs,milk,wool and meat.The meat goes to FMC at Swanwick and the wool goes to Bradford.He milks the cows and feeds the animals in winter on silage and hay cut in the summer and stored for the winter.
